meanings.definition: The state of being perishable or temporary.
meanings.sent1: The caducity of the flowers reminded us of the passing of time.
meanings.sent2: The caducity of youth is a natural part of life.
meanings.sent3: The caducity of the ice cream cone made us eat it quickly before it melted.
meanings.sent4: The caducity of fame can be a harsh reality for many celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The caducity of the autumn leaves painted a beautiful but fleeting picture.

meanings.definition: The quality of being transitory or fleeting.
meanings.sent1: We marveled at the caducity of the shooting star streaking across the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The caducity of happiness can make us appreciate joyful moments even more.
meanings.sent3: The caducity of the soap bubbles entertained the children as they chased them.
meanings.sent4: The caducity of a rainbow reminds us to cherish moments of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The caducity of a snowflake is a reminder of nature's delicate balance.
